conbody.p: MOTODEV Studio for Android offers unsurpassed workflow ease and a unique integrated experience for developing Android applications. One installer brings you everything you need: from design to development to deployment on an Android handset to sales, with a focus on Motorola products. MOTODEV Studio for Android saves you many steps so you can focus on creativity while maximizing productivity.
Among the many features of MOTODEV Studio for Android are:

ul.li: Complete Development Package: one installer ensures an integrated development environment with Eclipse and Android Development Tools (ADT) plus automatic download of the Android SDKs, add-ons, and samples on 32-bit or 64-bit versions of Microsoft Windows and Linux, and 64-bit versions of Mac OS X. All of the essentials are set up for you. Or, install as plugins into an existing Eclipse installation.
Native Development: Build projects with native (C/C++) components, generate C/C++ classes from native function declarations in your Java source files.

App Validator: Detect and repair problems before your app is distributed. The App Validator checks your app for a wide range of improper conditions: missing permissions and translated strings, improper layouts, incompatibilities with various devices, and problems with your Java code such as unclosed database cursors.
Code Generation: Automatically generate code to access UI widgets defined in your xml-based layout files.

Device Management View: Easily create and manage AVDs (Android Virtual Devices), and set AVD startup options using the Device Management view. Use this view to quickly launch an ADB shell or Emulator Console.
Screen Capture: From the Device Management view you can easily capture an image of the screen on a real or emulated device.
Handset Emulators in a view: test applications on an integrated emulator within a MOTODEV Studio view: no need to switch between IDE and target. Make use of handset-specific emulators.
Target Motorola Handsets: debug and run applications on connected Android handsets, such as those available from Motorola, Mobility.
Application Creation Wizards: create essential classes simply and easily, including Broadcast Receiver, Content Provider, Service, and Activity.
Drag and Drop Snippets: add often-used code from templates for more stable and better performing applications.
Application Signing: create and import certificates to sign applications.
Deploy Packages: load your applications onto a target handset or emulator with just a few clicks. Easily export zip-aligned packages (signed or unsigned) compatible with Google Play.
MOTODEV Studio Perspective: displays the most common development views by default.
MOTODEV Database Perspective: allows you to view and edit SQLite databases on developer handsets and emulated devices.
Localization Files Editor: helps you to create, translate, and manage localized strings files.
RSS Feeds view: includes feeds from Motorola, Inc. related to Android app development and marketing.
MOTODEV Web Resources: this web page, presented as an Eclipse view, contains links to MOTODEV Studio release notes and other helpful resources on the web.
